result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:16 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Christopher Ray Gates in court, in custody.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Christopher Ray Gates.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CF136 (RW), 21CF647 (RW), 22CF9 (RW), & 22CF132 (RW/INIT).  DE does qualify for PD. Court QUASHES WARRANT. Atty Dofli believes Atty Firkus represents him on a Polk County matter, PD's office to reach out to Atty Firkus to see if he'll take these files.  As to 22CF132- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. DE updates address on file.  DE still has pending matters in Polk County. Court notes of the 4 SCC cases, PH needs to be held on 3 of the 4 files.  Bond argument.  Court orders bond. Adjourned at 1:24 PM. bph
Review scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 07:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher Ray Gates
Current: 520 Lake Summit Court, Shoreview, MN 55126 United States  (Effective: 01-06-2022)
Prior: 120 - 3rd Avenue, Clear Lake, WI 54005

- Defendant to test today, January 6, 2022

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Day Report Center agreement on today's date. I further understand that I am required to submit to random DRUG testing, at least 1 time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in an arrest warrant and/or referral for criminal charges. (715)245-4109. Pending further order, when reporting to the DRC, you MUST wear a mask  (PPE).

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

11:28 AM   Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris,ADA:  Bela Alexander Ballo   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Christopher Ray Gates appeared. Includes 22CF9, and RW on 21CF136 and 21CF647. Court reviews case and quashes authorization for warrant. Def got his dates confused. RE: 22CF9 - Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Court administratively transfers 22CF9 to Branch 3. Court orders DEF to test today. Def is not to be arrested.  Court to schedule PH for 22CF647 and 22CF9. Def does not have a license to drive to St. Croix County to test. Court to consider less frequent testing after Def shows good faith.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
